pullRequest.title: FM2-145: Add display property to concept translator with translations
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description of what I changed


OpenMrs has translations for  concept name store in the database.
Concept provides a method where you can retrieve concept name by locale concept.getName(locale).  The next step is getting DefaultLocale which can be achieved by either;

Using Context.getLocale() -> Bad
Using globalProperty globalPropertyService.getGlobalProperty("default_locale", "en_GB"). It's already been managed.

Problem
There are No translations for extensions and those code added as value-set (which don't exist as concepts in openmrs)
Issue I worked on




see https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/FM2-145

nodes.bodyText: It's stored in the user_property table with the user_id equal to the user_id and the property equal to defaultLocale (OpenmrsConstants.USER_PROPERTY_DEFAULT_LOCALE). Of course, the difficult thing is "how do we know who the current user is". Unfortunately, this information is stored in a ThreadLocal object stored in Context...

I'd suggest that rather than doing this, we replace the _ with - and call Locale.forLanguageTag() with the resulting string. The reason is that this way we can support a much wider range of locales than is possible if we assume this rather narrow format.
